alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Stillwater (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 08 at 2:19PM MDT until June 08 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WEST CENTRAL CARBON AND SOUTH CENTRAL STILLWATER COUNTIES... At 219 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain in and around the Beartooth foothills, including Red Lodge Creek and East Rosebud Creek. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain fell. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Luther and Roscoe. While the most intense rainfall has moved out of this region at this time, additional thunderstorm development is possible through the afternoon and evening hours. Any thunderstorms that do develop will have the potential to produce another quick 1 to 2 inches of rainfall. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
